alert.note: Alert for Pontotoc; Union (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 05 at 3:54PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Pontotoc, southeastern Union and northwestern Lee Counties through 415 PM CDT... At 353 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Blair, or 10 miles northwest of Tupelo. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Saltillo, Guntown, Blair, New Harmony, Sherman, Blue Springs, Endville, Branyan, Ellistown, Alpine, Birmingham, Jug Fork, Corrona, Graves, Frog Island, Reese, Fairfield and Boggan Bend. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
